description: From Anglo-Norman afier, from Late Latin affidare.

verbs.description: affy (third-person singular simple present affies, present participle affying, simple past and past participle affied)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, intransitive) To trust (in someone or something); to rely (on). [14th–17th c.]
(obsolete, transitive) To promise to marry (someone); to be engaged to. [16th–17th c.]
(slang) An affidavit to be signed by a contest winner to confirm eligibility.
examples: If you have won a monthly prize, they will send you an affy and have you send it back. Then your prize comes from a courier.
